scenarioDescription:
The Pr0201 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Pr0201 is a star with 1.24 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.15 times its radius. It is located 589.17 light years away from the solar system.

Pr0201 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Pr0201 system


Pr0201 b

Pr0201 b was discovered by the Fred Lawrence Whipple Observatory observatory, in 2012-09, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Pr0201 b is 171.720 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Pr0201 b is 14.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Pr0201 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Pr0201, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Fred Lawrence Whipple Observatory.
name: Pr0201 - System With 1 Exoplanet
